channel.title: System cannot find path specified
channel.description: [img]http://img836.imageshack.us/img836/1090/aaa2c.jpg[/img] it would be nice if someone could help me :)

item.title: System cannot find path specified
item.dc:creator: @server868 server868
item.description:
@server868 wrote:

I swear nobody ever uses the search bar

EVER!

I have seen this posted so many times. The answer is simple:
You need to edit your compiler.bat to aim at YOUR java version

Example (idk how to do code thing):

@echo off
Title Compiling…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

See how I have jdk1.6.0_13?
Change that to your version.

Read full topic

item.title: System cannot find path specified
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

Sounds like it can’t find your Java JDK folder.

Try right clicking your compiler.batch and delete everything and replace it with this.

@echo off
Color 0a
:menu
title compiler
@echo Compiling.....
if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") 
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
"%programfiles%\InternetExplorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Compiling Finished.
pause
exit

Read full topic
